snippet: A sprawling factory that churns out the profitable Jeep Grand Cherokee has become a symbol of hope that Detroit’s downward spiral can be reversed.
abstract: Revival of Chrysler factory that churns out profitable Jeep Grand Cherokee has become a symbol of hope that Detroit’s downward spiral can be reversed; few could have envisioned turnaround when Chrysler tumbled into 2009 bankruptcy, but government bailout, along with two-tiered pay structure that cut wages for new employees by $12 an hour, saved company and delivered it into the hands of Fiat, which now is its majority owner.
lead_paragraph: A sprawling factory that churns out the profitable Jeep Grand Cherokee has become a symbol of hope that Detroit’s downward spiral can be reversed.

headline.main: Last Car Plant Brings Detroit Hope and Cash
headline.print_headline: Last Car Plant Brings Detroit Hope and Cash
